title: Gig Economy Race to Bottom
context: Gig economy platforms — Uber, DoorDash, Fiverr, Upwork, TaskRabbit — promise flexibility and freedom. Be your own boss. Work when you want. Set your own rates. The reality for most gig workers is a race to the bottom driven by platform dynamics. Platforms profit from oversupply: more workers means lower prices, faster fulfillment, and better customer experience. So they continuously recruit new workers, driving down per-gig earnings. Workers compete on price because the platform controls discovery and ranking. The 'flexibility' of gig work means no benefits, no job security, no career progression, and earnings that often fall below minimum wage after accounting for expenses. The platforms externalize the costs of employment (healthcare, retirement, equipment, insurance) onto workers while capturing the value of their labor through take rates of 20-40%.
hypothesis: Gig platforms create flexible work opportunities that benefit workers and consumers.

chain.root: Platform recruits maximum number of gig workers to ensure supply

effects.impact: No benefits, no insurance, no retirement, no equipment reimbursement

children.label: Healthcare costs borne entirely by worker — $400-800/month for individual coverage

effects.impact: Platform controls pricing, matching, and visibility

effects.label: Traditional employment in affected sectors degrades
effects.impact: Gig competition drives down wages in adjacent industries

children.label: Restaurants cut delivery staff because DoorDash is cheaper (for the restaurant)

impact.metric: Median gig worker hourly earnings (after expenses)
impact.delta: Below minimum wage in many states

dontIf: Gig work is your sole income source and you don't have 6 months of savings
You haven't calculated your true hourly rate after all expenses including vehicle depreciation
ifYouMust: Track all expenses meticulously — vehicle costs, insurance, self-employment tax — to know your real hourly rate
Diversify across multiple platforms to reduce dependency on any single algorithm
Set a minimum hourly rate and decline gigs below it regardless of acceptance rate pressure
Budget for self-employment tax (15.3%), health insurance, and retirement savings from gross earnings

alternatives.name: Direct client relationships
alternatives.note: Build your own client base outside platforms — keep 100% of earnings

alternatives.name: Worker cooperatives
alternatives.note: Platform cooperatives owned by workers — same technology, worker-aligned incentives

alternatives.name: Part-time employment with benefits
alternatives.note: Many employers offer benefits at 20-30 hours/week — more stable than gig work
